ir:
For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable owner will be updated to 0xaF9C025Ce6322A23ac00301C714f4F42895c9818.
- the state variable owner1 will be updated to 0x6842a9ad0BC604c1D9330190B9035051a7525569.

For the withdrawAffiliateCommision function.
- When the affiliatecommision of the address is greater than 0:
  - the affiliatecommision of caller will be updated to 0.
  - it transfers ether valued the affiliatecommision of the address to caller.

For the withdraw function.
- When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
  - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
  - it transfers ether valued ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) to caller.

For the reinvestProfit function.
- When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
  - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
  - the investedeth of caller will be updated to (((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600)+the investedeth of the address).

For the payable investETH function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than 0x6f05b59d3b20000:
  - the affiliatecommision of owner will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner).
  - the affiliatecommision of owner1 will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner1).
  - the investedeth of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the investedeth of caller).
  - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
  - For users, except for the first argument, and 1 does not equal to the first argument, and owner does not equal to the first argument, and owner1 does not equal to the first argument:
    - the affiliatecommision of the first argument will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of the first argument).
    - When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
      - the affiliatecommision of the first argument will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of the first argument).
  - When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
    - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
    - it transfers ether valued ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) to caller. Afterthat, 
      - the investedeth of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the investedeth of caller).
    - the affiliatecommision of owner will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner).
    - the affiliatecommision of owner1 will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner1).
    - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.

messages.content: You are an experienced smart contract developer that excels at Solidity program languages. Please write a contract code by the following contract descriptions. Some state variables and programming specifications are provided to help you develop.

The following is the description of the contract logic: For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable owner will be updated to 0xaF9C025Ce6322A23ac00301C714f4F42895c9818.
- the state variable owner1 will be updated to 0x6842a9ad0BC604c1D9330190B9035051a7525569.

For the withdrawAffiliateCommision function.
- When the affiliatecommision of the address is greater than 0:
  - the affiliatecommision of caller will be updated to 0.
  - it transfers ether valued the affiliatecommision of the address to caller.

For the withdraw function.
- When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
  - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
  - it transfers ether valued ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) to caller.

For the reinvestProfit function.
- When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
  - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
  - the investedeth of caller will be updated to (((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600)+the investedeth of the address).

For the payable investETH function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than 0x6f05b59d3b20000:
  - the affiliatecommision of owner will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner).
  - the affiliatecommision of owner1 will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner1).
  - the investedeth of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the investedeth of caller).
  - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
  - For users, except for the first argument, and 1 does not equal to the first argument, and owner does not equal to the first argument, and owner1 does not equal to the first argument:
    - the affiliatecommision of the first argument will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of the first argument).
    - When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
      - the affiliatecommision of the first argument will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of the first argument).
  - When ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) is greater than 0, and (current time-the lastinvest of the address) is not 0:
    - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.
    - it transfers ether valued ((the investedeth of caller*(current time-the lastinvest of the address))/0x54600) to caller. Afterthat, 
      - the investedeth of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the investedeth of caller).
    - the affiliatecommision of owner will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner).
    - the affiliatecommision of owner1 will be updated to ((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/20)+the affiliatecommision of owner1).
    - the lastinvest of caller will be updated to current time.

.
 Here are some state variables with their corresponding types: public state variable `investedeth` is typed mapping,public state variable `lastinvest` is typed mapping,public state variable `affiliatecommision` is typed mapping,private state variable `owner` is typed address,private state variable `owner1` is typed address.
 Here are some programming specifications: - You must declare a variable before you can use it, but the same variable cannot be declared twice
- You must lock the pragma and use a stable version (e.g., pragma solidity `0.6.12`).
- For exteranal calls, you must use `.call()` instead of `.transfer()` and `.send()`.
- The target address who receives ether must be `payable address` type.
- You must make the function `payable` if `msg.value` is used in the public functions.
- From security perspectives, you must check whether an overflow or underflow is possible before an arithmetic operation (e.g., safemath operations), and you should determine whether the user's address is empty before transferring ether to the him.
- You cannot import external resources because you are a separate contract.
- You must use the following methods in new versions rather than old methods
  - For some built-in functions, 
    - `abi.encodePacked(...) returns (bytes memory)` performs packed encoding of arguments to bytes.
    - `keccak256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the Keccak-256 hash of the input.
    - `sha256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the SHA-256 hash of the input.
    - `ecrecover(bytes32 hash, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s) returns (address)` recovers the address associated with the public key from elliptic curve signature or return zero on error. 
  - For some properties,
    - `block.number (uint)` returns the current block number.
    - `block.timestamp (uint)` returns the current block timestamp as seconds since unix epoch.
    - `blockhash(uint blockNumber) returns (bytes32)` returns the hash of the given block.
- `0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff` means `-1`, so `+0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff` indeed means `-1`.
